answers.answer: First you say, "...under the guidence of our phisician. and we are also satisfied with his decision." Then you close with, "i am Unable to trust my physician."  Which is it? Best read and educate yourself about the medication side effects, some may pertain to his appetite loss and whatever you mean by "ommiting problem."

question: my father is having diabetes last 10 years. one month before, he had been admitted to hospital for around 18 days for the reason of urine problem and diabetes.At that time, his sugar was above normal level(random-396mg/dl) and other pathalogiacal reports are as under:-HB:- 7.8WBC:-17,600BUL-78S CREATININE:-2.96USG:- significant post void urine residueHISTOPATHALOGY:- TSH function-1.5S. ELECTROLYTES:-NA-139K-48CL-102INSULINE DOSE:- inj. Human Actrapid(10@morning-12@noon-10@night)At present ,his pathalogical reports are as under:-he is taking AZULIX(2MG) instead of injection under the guidence of our phisician. and we are also satisfied with his decision.BLOOD SUGAR:-fasting:119 mg/dlPP:143 mg/dlHB:-7.3WBC:-6,900BLOOD UREA :-27.00S.CREATININE:-1.07S.ELECTROLYTES;-SODIUM:--123POTASSIUM:-3.5CLORIDES;-91THYROID FUNCTION TEST:-T3;-1.41T4:-8.9TSH:-2.25he is undergoing following medication:-tab fersoft-z:-                          0-1-0tab Azulix(1mg):-                    1-0-0tab happy-m:-                         1-0-1tab Geriflo                              0-0-1tab Dytor-10                           1-0-0cap Rinifol                              0-0-1but I am not satisfied with my physician treatment because my father is suffering from loss of appetite and ommiting problem. from this Situation, i am Unable to trust my physician.please, suggest some powerful treatment as early as possible.Thanking You,
title: my father having Diabetes
